definition: abbr. for 國家發展和改革委員會|国家发展和改革委员会, PRC National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), formed in 2003
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
surname Wei
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly

sentences.english: It was the first such speculation by an NDRC official.
sentences.chinese: 這是發改委官方第一次做出的這樣的推測。

sentences.english: Zhang Yansheng, chief economist under the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), held a similar view.
sentences.chinese: 中國發改委主要經濟學者張嚴升也發表了類似的看法。

sentences.english: Hu Henghua was appointed Director of the Development and Reform Commission of Hunan province.
sentences.chinese: 任命胡衡華爲湖南省發改委主任。

sentences.english: The National Reform and Development Commission announced it had rejected a request for a price hike from four major cooking oil companies.
sentences.chinese: 國家發改委宣佈它已經拒絕四大食油公司的漲價要求。

sentences.english: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC) issued a notice clarifying the relevant price policy for gas storage facilities.
sentences.chinese: 發改委發佈關於明確儲氣設施相關價格政策的通知。

sentences.english: That's what Wal-Mart and Carrefour were charged with by China's National Development and Reform Commission earlier this year.
sentences.chinese: 這就是今年沃爾瑪和家樂福被中國發改委指控的原因。

sentences.english: That is the size of the state Development and Reform Commission officials to hear.
sentences.chinese: 就是說給國家發改委的大小官員聽的。
